definition: Asura, malevolent spirits in Indian mythology
prefix used before monosyllabic names, kinship terms etc to indicate familiarity/used in transliteration/also pr. [a4]
abbr. for Afghanistan 阿富汗[A1 fu4 han4]
dried meat/private teacher's remuneration/withered/variant of 修[xiu1]
to decorate/to embellish/to repair/to build/to write/to cultivate/to study/to take (a class)

sentences.english: When Sakka had said this verse, the devas applauded but the asuras were silent.
sentences.chinese: 天帝释唱此偈时，诸天欢呼，阿修罗默然。

sentences.english: And I do not think there is anything wrong of Asura.
sentences.chinese: 我没有认为阿修罗有什么不好。

sentences.english: The asuras live on the sea bottom.
I think Ashura is a very interesting material.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得阿修罗是非常有意思的物质。

sentences.english: The male Asura is extremely ugly and furious, and they always fight with each other.
sentences.chinese: 男性阿修罗是非常丑陋，愤怒，他们总是互相斗争。

sentences.english: Asura is one peculiar kind of the six destinies(ways).
sentences.chinese: 阿修罗是特有的六道众生之一。

sentences.english: Now the prayer is that "we Gods may quell our Asura foemen."
sentences.chinese: “现在，祈祷的是，”我们可以平息我们的神阿修罗。

definition: Asura, malevolent spirits in Indian mythology
demon in Buddhism/poltergeist in temple that plays tricks on monks and has a taste for their food
Nirvana (in Buddhist scripture)/Lord Brahma (the Hindu Creator)
the intersection of the Moon's orbit with the ecliptic in Vedic astronomy (Sanskrit rahu)
Ceaseless pain (Sanskrit: Avici), one of the Buddhist hells/fig. hell/hell on earth
the Yellow Springs/the underworld of Chinese mythology/the equivalent of Hades or Hell
